articleinfo.title: Ulteo Open Virtual Desktop
articleinfo.subtitle: Application Server on GNU/Linux Debian 5.0 (Lenny) installation

article.para: The purpose of this document is to install a Ulteo OVD Application Server on a GNU/Linux Debian 5.0 (Lenny) system without any subsystem, using directly the locals applications.

important.para: This server won't support all OVD features because it's not using a Ulteo OVD subsystem. For instance, it won't be possible to install/remove application of this server using the Ulteo OVD Administration Console.

section.title: Prerequisites

listitem.para: A installed GNU/Linux Debian 5.0 (Lenny) system (x86 or amd64).
An internet connexion that allow HTTP or the Ulteo OVD DVD to install debian packages.
An Ulteo OVD Session Manager installed and configured.

important.para: The Application Server system have to be a dedicated system for Ulteo OVD usage. It can also hosts another Ulteo OVD roles. But we don't garantees the system will works if you are using another services on ths system.
In this document, we are using sm.ulteo.com for the Session Manager address.
You need to set that names according to your own domain names.

section.para: All operations need to be done as super user (root).

listitem.para: Edit the /etc/apt/sources.list.d/ulteo-ovd.list and add these lines:
listitem.screen: deb http://archive.ulteo.com/ovd/3.0/debian lenny main deb http://archive.ulteo.com/ovd/desktop hardy main universe ulteo

note.para: GPG errors given by the previous command will be fixed in the next installation steps. They won't prevent the installation to be successful.

listitem.para: Install the keyring package to validate the repository using gpg:

listitem.screen: # apt-get install ulteo-ovd-desktop ulteo-ovd-slaveserver-role-aps xfonts-base xfonts-encodings

listitem.para: The only question is about the host/IP address where the session manager can be accessed. (we use here for the example, but of course, you have to set your own domain name).

article.para: The configuration is now done. The service should be started at the end of the installation, you should see the server appear in the unregistered server page of your Session Manager.
